name: Andrew Stalker
title: Principal Software Engineer
summary: Results-driven Principal Software Engineer with 9+ years of full-stack experience architecting high-scale distributed systems and microservices ecosystems. Proven technical leader at Liberty Mutual, specializing in modern stack migrations (Angular/TypeScript + Java/Spring Boot) and cloud-native architectures on AWS to deliver scalable, resilient solutions with operational excellence. Excel at guiding cross-functional teams, mentoring engineers, and leveraging agentic AI (GitHub Copilot) alongside CI/CD pipelines to boost performance 20–30%, reduce bugs, and align technical roadmaps with business outcomes. Proven in high-pressure environments—from Army deployments to production launches—delivering scalable solutions that prioritize clarity, iteration, and efficiency.

experience.title: Principal Software Engineer
highlights: Acted as a technical leader in the Small Commercial Products Tech team, guiding the development of system, technical, and product standards while leading the end-to-end delivery of flagship products, including the current build of the new Workers Comp product on a modern scalable stack (Angular/TypeScript + Java/Spring).

Shipped multiple products and enhancements, delivering across the small commercial portfolio (BOP, Commercial Package, Simple BOP, Auto), consistently enhancing core functionality with zero major disruptions.
Implemented Angular + NgRx for predictable data flows and scalable state management, streamlining front-end development and reducing UI bugs by establishing reusable patterns.

Integrated third-party APIs to extend interoperability and cross-system workflows; leveraged GitHub Copilot and agentic AI to author production-ready, performant code 20–30% faster, saving team time on routine tasks while upholding quality standards in scalable environments.

Collaborated directly with Product Management and Architecture to define the long-term technical roadmap for key systems, strategically planning incremental migrations and ensuring alignment with enterprise-wide cloud goals.

experience.title: Senior Software Engineer
highlights: Built robust, scalable full-stack web applications using Angular for front-end and Java/Spring Boot for back-end, supporting agile sprints that delivered high-quality solutions on time for insurance product enhancements.
Designed multithreaded/async Java algorithms to boost search responsiveness and UX, resulting in materially faster query times for high-volume insurance workflows.
Committed to professional growth by tracking industry trends, attending conferences, and sharing knowledge via internal workshops, mentoring juniors to boost team-wide adoption of best practices.

experience.title: Software Engineer
highlights: Developed and optimized full-stack features in enterprise insurance systems, focusing on performance and scalability to handle increasing transaction volumes.
Contributed to agile teams in refactoring legacy codebases, improving system reliability and developer productivity.
Supported back-end development with Java/Spring, assisting in API builds and database integrations for core products.

experience.title: Lead Full Stack Web Developer
highlights: Developed, tested, and maintained Risque—an enterprise suite for Purdue's networking infrastructure—using C#, ASP.NET, and Microsoft SQL Server to document and manage campus systems.
Created and optimized complex SQL queries, enhancing data retrieval efficiency for infrastructure management.
Built responsive web pages with ASP.NET, HTML5, and CSS3, improving user accessibility across diverse devices.

experience.title: Signals Intelligence Analyst & Cavalry Scout / Scout Team Leader
highlights: Led Reconnaissance (Scout) and Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) teams, utilizing advanced data analysis and surveillance to track and target high-value assets during combat deployments (Afghanistan, Operation Iraqi Freedom).
Led combat patrols and security operations built discipline in ambiguous, high-pressure environments.

Supervised SIGINT/EW operations, analyzing foreign communications to produce combat, strategic, and tactical reports. Led analysis teams in real-time data processing, honing skills in pattern recognition and rapid reporting transferable to software debugging and optimization.

education.details: Emphasis on Software Engineering. Minor in Communication. Dean's List & Semester Honors
